text:
Friday, I have installed apache 1.3.24 and when I go on http://www.voila.fr for 
example, I have a number like 821 displayed at the bottom of the page, that is 
to say the source is :

821
<HTML>
... etc...

I don't know why a randomly number is displayed...

But, I have a more serious problem with apache-1.2.4 : on 
http://www.google.com, when I try to search anything, I have a blank page after 
to press on "search". 

I have the same problem after a reinstallation... Then, today, I have 
reinstalled apache-1.2.3 and all is ok... Then, it seems that apache-1.2.4 have 
bugs...

I hope to help you...

Christophe LEFEBVRE
creator: clefebvre@santerne.fr
slive@apache.org
text:
Your report is confusing.  What does Apache have to do with
google?  Are you using Apache as a proxy?

If you have more details, please reopen this report.

creator: clefebvre@santerne.fr
text:
I use the proxy module of Apache. I configure Apache like this :
./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache 
--activate-module=src/modules/proxy/libproxy.a 
--activate-module=src/modules/php4/libphp4.a --with-layout=RedHat
I don't use any patch.

creator: slive@apache.org
text: Well, then lets make the summary a little more relevant.

I know this bug was reported first, but I'm marking it as a dupe of 7513 because
the exaplanation over there is clearer.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7513 ***
creator: slive@apache.org
